key_title: Key to the species of Triglochin

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Juncaginaceae

source.author: Conn, B.J.; Aston, H.I.
source.title: Juncaginaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J.; Aston, H.I. (1994). Juncaginaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Perennial rhizomatous herbs; fruits lacking acute projections

Basal leaf-sheath distally extended to form a short ligule; inflorescence made up of 2 solitary sessile female flowers and one stalked spike of bisexual flowers arising from axil of each basal leaf-sheath; style short in bisexual flower, long and thread-like in female flower
Basal leaf-sheath without a ligule; inflorescence many-flowered, racemose or spike-like; flowers all bisexual; style short
Fruit projections basal or distal, c. 1–1.5 mm long; fruit 1–2.5 mm wide
Fruit projections up to 0.5 mm long, basal or as lateral wings; fruit 0.4–1.2 mm wide
Carpels 3, all fertile; fruit 6-sided, subcylindric basally (slightly broader at base), abruptly conical distally
Carpels 6, 3 fertile alternating with 3 sterile; fruit inverted-pyramidal or narrowly pyramidal
Fruit narrowly pyramidal; fertile carpels basally with 2 lateral recurved spurs c. 1–1.5 mm long, often with 2 small deflexed spurs connected by a membrane between the larger recurved spurs
Fruit inverted-pyramidal, distally with spreading points c. 1 mm long
Fruits angular-oblong, fertile carpels distally and basally with 4 lateral wings, such that each carpel appears 6-angled when viewed dorsally
Fruits narrowly pyramidal to suboblong, rarely ovoid; fertile carpels basally with 2 lateral acute or obtuse points, rarely also with 2 minute downward points
Fruit broadly ovoid, more than 0.6 mm wide; fertile carpels with 2 lateral points and 2 minute downward points
Fruits narrowly pyramidal to suboblong, less than 0.6 mm wide, if more than 0.6 mm wide, pyramidal, never ovoid; fertile carpels with 2 lateral points
Fruits less than 2.2 mm long, sessile, pedicle less than 0.2 mm long
Fruits  (2.2–)3.2–5.8 mm long, subsessile, pedicle usually more than 0.2 mm long
Fruit narrowly pyramidal, convex dorsally, more than 0.5 mm wide; fertile carpels with basal lateral points 0.1–0.5 mm long
Fruit narrowly cylindric, flattened dorsally, c. 0.5 mm wide; fertile carpels with basal lateral points up to c. 0.1 mm long
